Question
========

In a *random sample* of 100 women, 40% are found to smoke; in a *random sample* of 100 men, it is 60%. The 95% confidence interval for the difference between the corresponding population proportions is then

Answerlist
----------

* (-0.14, +0.14)
* (-0.34, -0.06)
* (-0.38, -0.02)

Solution
========

Answerlist
----------

* (-0.14, +0.14): Incorrect
* (-0.34, -0.06): Correct
* (-0.38, -0.02): Incorrect
